data.description:
A mockup of the 2008 iPhone app "I Am Rich" which survived 24 hours on the Apple App Store before being pulled. 

** Goal: 50 hearts for Aplite and Chalk support. ** COMPLETED AND UPDATED.

** New Stretch Goal: 85 hearts and I will add timeline support with daily quotes about wealth and money. ** REACHED - CURRENTLY IN DEVELOPMENT. DEV STARTED ON JAN 11 2016 AND TO BE FINISHED AT END OF JAN 2016.

** Another stretch goal: 140 hearts and I will create a "Be my Valentine" app for Valentine's Day. **

The original iPhone app had no purpose except for showing people how rich you were to be able to spend US $999 on absolutely nothing. 

You can now experience the original app in all its glory without paying a single cent. Simply press the select button to bring up the original message that appeared in the app and press the same button again to dismiss the message.

Furthermore, the app is now on your Pebble making it even easier to show off your supposed wealth to others.

data.description:
It's a simple catcher game.
You have 2 modes of play : time mode and lives mode.
In time mode you will play until time goes to 0.
In lives mode you will play until no lives left.
You have to catch tears (black and white).
In time mode you can catch a clock for adding time.
Black tear add two points to score, white add four points.
Added animation of objects crashed.
In lives mode there are five lives and for the moment there weren't added none while playing.
It saves the 5 hightest score to pebble for every mode : 5 for lives mode and another 5 for time mode. 
Menu and messages are shown in 4 configurable languages : spanish , english , tagalog and waray.
Waray language already not yet, waray for the moment is the same as english.
Tagalog language with the help of google translate, not revised.
Default language is spanish.

data.author: Richard Johnson

changelog.release_notes: Fixed a problem which resulted in messages being displayed even for days when they should not have been.  Added versions for newest Pebble watches.
Fixed a bug which kept the app from correctly reloading information when it restarts.  This prevented alarms from happening the next day, after working the first time.
Updated to use the "Clay" configuration package, which means it no longer requires an Internet connection in order to configure alarms.

This  set of changes allows the program to set alarms which only work
on specific days of the week.  By default, they all happen on all days,
until you turn some days off.  This also adds the menu item to allow
the user to re-do the last alarm.  You can then snooze it.  (Useful if
you accidentally ack'ed an alarm which you didn't mean to.)  It also
changes the default snooze time from 10 to 20 minutes.

Fixed various bugs, removed scheduling alarms via older API and relying totally on the new API now, which simplified the code.  Fixed problem where an alarm could not be scheduled if it happened to be at the same time as a different alarm, even if that different alarm was in a different program.  (It will not move an alarm forward by a minute or more, if needed, in order to get it scheduled.

New menu item, at the bottom, to "Disable alarms".  This will keep your alarm definitions around but will disable all of them.  Introduced some new screens related to this, just to make it clear when alarms are disabled.  If you do "show alarms", they will appear in parentheses to show they're disabled.  If you do "show next alarm", it will say they're disabled.

Made some changes to make sure it clearly displays when an alarm is being pushed out by one or more days, displaying the time and then "+1", "+2", etc.

Fixed a bug where the program wasn't saving the actual alarm times, so if you restarted the program, it wouldn't remember that an alarm had been pushed out by a day or so.  It now saves this information.
This version should correctly insert and remove timeline pins. It also allows a choice of four different fonts.

data.description: Daily alarms with custom notes, automatically rescheduled to the next day.  Great for taking various different pills on a daily basis.  (Do not rely totally on these reminders.  Bugs may be present, even though I have tried to verify correct working in many situations.). Time changes are not handled and would be hard to handle.  Just select "reset alarms" when changing time zones.

data.description:
Follow Me! uses your Pebble  Time to let others track your GPS position when you want to.

Select the current activity from the watch and share your link (from the configuration page) with your friends so they can track your location whenever the app is active on your Pebble.

As of version 1.2, Voice support was added.  Add a status to your location by speaking to your Pebble Time.

How it works:
- Select any activity.  It will show up on your shared link webpage (http://followme.crombz.com)
- Long press the Select button on any activity and Voice Dictation will start.  Record your message and it will be shown when you click on your map marker.

Warning:  Reporting the location does drain your battery a bit faster

Find out more at http://followme.crombz.com

changelog.release_notes: initial release

data.description:
This app shows the time by the vibration of up to 8 times.
No need to count the vibration and/or to learn the pattern.

Short vibration indicates the first half, long vibration will show the second half.

Repeat this watchface division images the position of the hour hand.

example " . "=short vibration " - "=long vibration

" . " : (watchface first half top) 12
" - " : (watchface second half) 6
" .- " : (first half's second half) 3
" .-. " : (first half's second half's first half) 4

After short blank, it will show the minute hand position in the same way.
You got time in 5-minute increments.
It does not vibrate when 0 minutes as an exception.

Last block shows detail minute.
+0min: no vibration
+1min: one short
+2min: two short
+3min: one long
+4min: one long and one short 
(To save the vibration, slightly irregular:)

After a series of vibration, the application will automatically exit back to the previous state(your watchface or app launcher).
It recommended to set quck-lunch or placing at the bottom of the application-list.

in Japanese.
文字盤を見れないけど時刻を知りたい時のために最高8回の振動で時刻を知らせます

短い振動は前半、長い振動は後半の法則で、これを繰り返して文字盤を分割していくイメージで、
分割した一番早い箇所が示す時刻です

最初に時針の位置を示します
例えば0時は前半の先頭なので、短い振動1回
同様に6時は長い振動1回、3時は前半の後半なので短・長、11時は後半の後半の後半なので長・長・長です
全部書くと
0:短 1:短短短 2:短短長 3:短長 4:短長短 5:短長長
6:長 7:長短短 8:長短長 9:長長 10:長長短 11:長長長
ですが、パターンを憶えずに、振動を感じながら頭の中で文字盤を分割すると良いです

短い空白の後、同様に分針の5分刻みの位置を示します

最後に5分以内の分を知らせますが、振動を節約する為やや不規則です
+0分：振動無し
+1分：短
+2分：短短
+3分：長
+4分：長短
短：1分・長：3分と憶えたほうが早いかも

通知が終わるとアプリは自動的に終了し以前の状態(時計もしくはアプリケーションの一覧)に戻ります
クイックランチに設定するか、アプリケーション一覧の一番下に配置しておくと、目隠しの状態でも起動できて便利です
data.title: vibration watch

data.description:
Thanks for 50 ❤️'s!

WARNING: Can have high power consumption! 

Please ❤️ Money maker

Debugged by johannesn. Awesome leaderboard by Kyle H.

Click the middle button. Make money, and then more money, then more money. 

Then Click down for the main menu. Click 'manual jobs' (Jobs that increase how much you get from each click) Get a new job by paying the money below the job name. This will make it, so you get more per click - price ÷ 50. 

Click 'auto jobs' (Jobs that work themselves, and don't need to be clicked) Get more people by paying the money below the name. This will make it, so you get more per second - price ÷ 100. 

Keep an eye on your arrested chance! Every minute it goes up by 5%. You can lower this by doing good deeds. If you get arrested, you must wait 5 minutes. You cannot make money at all during this. If you leave during the sentence, you must serve five more minutes.

Click 'houses' (every five clicks you get your house bonus) Get a house by paying the money below the name. This will make it, so you get more per five clicks - price ÷ 50. 

Click 'items' (Cool stuff you can buy) Get stuff by paying the money below the name. 

Click 'multipliers' (boost your money making for 60 seconds) Get a bonus by spending the money below the name. This will make it, so you get more money for 60 seconds.

Keep on doing this until you own... THE WORLD!!

If you see any glitches, email me at the email below. There is a reset button if needed.

Disclaimer: No actual money is involved with playing this app/game
data.title: Money Maker

changelog.release_notes: Variant of MultiCounter created upon request by someone trying to keep track of weights in the gym. This adds a decimal point to allow counting by 100ths.

data.description:
People are bad at remembering numbers. Pebble is good at always being on and displaying numbers. Use this app to count and remember up to 4 decimal numbers at a time. Don't worry about leaving to do something else with your watch, it will remember where you left off the next time you return.

Use the right buttons to select which number to modify. Once you are modifying a number press the select button to switch between counting by 0.01, 0.10, 1.00, or 10.00. If you count high enough (or low enough) your number may run off the screen.

Hold down the increment button or decrement button to count really fast or press and release to get a single count.

Hold down the select button to reset the count to 0.

Press the back button to return to selecting your number.

Like all my apps, I don't want you to loose your phone so you will get a short long short vibration if your bluetooth is disconnected. An icon will show in the top left corner.

Heart MultiCounter if you like it and check out Timeline and my Precisioneer watchfaces. I appreciate the hearts on those too!

Counter

latest_release.release_notes: Variant of MultiCounter created upon request by someone trying to keep track of weights in the gym. This adds a decimal point to allow counting by 100ths.

data.description:
App updated every day, i'm still coding.
Anounces and bug reports at:

Twitter
@autommatic

With mapit you can send your location to yourself or others, via SMS or email, or post it on the Internet or whatever you want.
The possibilities are endless because IFTTT is behind this.

Creating a IFTTT recipe with a Maker Channel "like a trigger" you can send your location to anyone or just keep it for yourself and of course without using your mobile, just using our Pebble. 

Also you can get GPS persistent information.

The first thing you need is to be user of IFTTT app, is a GREAT service/app, the second is activate the Maker Channel.

On settings you can see a video that explains how to make it and you'll find a field to enter the url that gives you Maker Channel. Like this: 

"https://maker.ifttt.com/trigger/{EVENT_NAME}/with/key/{YOUR_KEY}"

changelog.release_notes:
Slice your time with TimeSlicer.

Whether you are working or working out, it's important to keep focus and to have regular breaks.  TimeSlicer warns you when it's time to have a break, and time to start working (out) again.

After the configured time (by default 25 minutes) your Pebble will vibrate, telling you it's time to have a break.  Stay focused until your Pebble vibrates.  No more looking at your watch again.

When resting time is over (by default 5 minutes) your Pebble will vibrate again.  Back to work.

Working time and resting time can be configured up to 99 minutes.  Use SELECT button to configure the times.

Use the UP button to temporarily pause the time.
Use the DOWN button to quickly switch to a new work or rest period.

data.description:
SimpleCalc:
  
A simple calculator for the pebble watch:

The functionality:
  Add, subtract, multiply and divide, nothing more complicated.  It is accurate
  up to 4 points to the right of the decimal point.  

Display:
  Top input display, this displays what has been entered and the total from
                     the calculations.
  
  Middle boxes, input boxes  
      Left Side: arithemitic operations, "+","-","*","/",".","=", All Clear,
      and Entry Clear;
      Right Side: Numbers to enter for calculations.
      
    
Operations:
  Up and Down buttons to change values in the input boxes, you can 
  traverse, up and down the input lists, the Middle button selects the current
  entry.
  Select button: selects the highlighted entry.
  Long Up, or down: switches input entry box sides, The current input box is 
           either a black box with white text for the pebble time, or 
           Dark blue with white text.

  NOTE:  After performing a calculation not clearing the input display 
         allows you to do more calculations using the total from the previous
         calculation.

If you find any bugs please email me at jclute1@gmail.com,  All help is appreciated.

latest_release.release_notes:
Bug Fix,
   Fixed the bug where if a person would subtract 1.11 and 1.10 instead of getting .01, it used to give .10.  It is now giving the correct value .01

changelog.release_notes:
v1.9: 
-Display not centered on pebble round (chalk) should be solved.
Error during drawing then moon phase
Build for pebble steel, pebble time and pebble round
Fix craching during drawing moon phase.

A drawing of the moon phase, according the difference of the right ascension (RA) of the moon and the sun, will be included in the first picture together with the moon slope ascending descending curve.
The second derivative d was not printed correct if the value d is < 0.1 Correction in presenting the floating point number d in the moon data section.

In this release the declination of the moon in time will be shown as a graph by pushing the center button.
The graph will be calculated locally in the pebble as the other coordinates for the sun and the moon.
The current day in the graph is the thick where the moon is presented as a small circle.

Correction in numerical value of derivatives.
Currently the first derivative of declination to time is normalized to (degree/day).
The second derivative of declination to time is normalized to (degree/(day*day))

1.1 Update and correcting derivative values. The first derivative from declination to time will be normalized to degree/hour and printed after the word Ascending / Descending obsigänd / nidsigänd word.
The second derivative from declination to time² will be normalized to degree /hour². 
The down bottom will show the MOON data. The select bottom (in the center) will give small navigation hints.

First release. All the calculation is done locally in pebble ( no link to internet is needed). The button in the middle on the right side of the pebble watch will show the position of the moon in astronomical coordinates (RA,DEC). If the current declination does increase (ascending moon) we call it in Swiss German (obsigend) if it is in the descending it is called (nidsigend), the descending moon. The value d is the second derivative of the slope. To get suns position (RA,DEC) click the upper bottom on the right of the pebbel. Especially the difference of the RA values shows moons phase. 12 hour full moon, 6 hour first quarter, 18 hour third quarter and 0 hour new moon. Remark: In a next release and if needed the accuracy of the object positions could be improved, now in the order of a few minutes, to less than one minute.

data.description:
Moon Ascending Descending Slope.
All the calculation is done locally in pebble ( no link to internet is needed). The moon declination slope will shown as a real calculated graph in pebble by pressing the center button. The ticks on the time axis are in units of day. The ticks on the declination axis are in units of degree. The down button on the right side of the pebble watch will show the position of the moon in celestial coordinates (RA,DEC). If the current declination does increase (ascending moon) we call it in Swiss German (obsigänd) if it is in the descending it is called (nidsigänd), the descending moon. The numerical value on the right is the first derivative of the declination to the time (degree/day). The value d is the second derivative of the declination to the time (degree/(day*day)). To get suns position (RA,DEC) click the upper bottom on the right of the pebbel. The difference of the RA values are representative for the moon phase, as example 12 hour full moon, 0 hour new moon. 
A drawing of the moon phase, according the difference of the right ascension (RA) of the moon and the sun, will be included in the first picture together with the moon slope ascending descending curve.
Remark: In a next release and if needed the accuracy of the object positions could be improved, now in the order of a few minutes, to less than one minute.

v1.9: 
-Display not centered on pebble round (chalk) should be solved.

data.title: Moon Ascending Descending

Calibration process is faster, user feedback shows the current calibration step.
"Shake" - initial calibration in progress no compass reading possible.
"Optimizing!" - compass calibrated, system still tweaks the calibration, compass reading reliable.
"Status: OK" - compass completely calibrated, compass reading reliable.

data.description:
Use the compass to get your bearings. Take a sighting along the side of your pebble, wait for the signal, snap your fingers on your watch-hand (or click the set-button) and the bearing is shown with large numbers in the display.

If the compass needs calibration, GetBearing asks you to shake. Dance, if you feel like it. After initial calibration, GetBearing shows the compass heading. The calibration continues in the background and the status message "Optimizing!" is shown. 

Visit www.cederstroem.com for more info.

data.description:
Rent a public bike directly from your watch!

Wherever Nextbike is available, so is your watch connected to the bike network. Rent a bike, see your rental status and find station without pulling your phone!

Nextbike is also known as: sz-bike (Dresden), Stadtrad (Innsbruck), Fächerrad (Karlsruhe), PotsdamRad, metropolradruhr, NorisBike (Nürnberg), Leihradl (Niederösterreich), BakuBike, WRM Wrocławski Rower Miejski, PRM Poznański Rower Miejski, Opole Rower Miejski, Bemowo Bike, Veturilo Warszawa, Belfast Bikes (Belfast, UK), Sixt rent a bicycle (Rīga/Jūrmala, Latvia), BYKYstations (Dubai, UAE), Healthy Ride (Pittsburgh, USA), SkyBike (West Palm Beach, USA) and many more.

In order to use this app, you need a Nextbike account. Please visit https://nextbike.com/ or your local equivalent first.

Features:
- list of closest stations using GPS, together with approximate distance and direction
- ability to rent a bike using list
- ability to enter number of bike manually
- rental info: big timer to quickly check how many minutes you've been riding for
- timeline support

Note: bike return currently not available, due to transient issues with Nextbike API. To return the bike, please use mobile app or contact customer support.

This is an unofficial client and I am not associated with Nextbike in any way.
data.title: Nextbike for Pebble

data.description:
This application is emulator of the 3-rotor Kriegsmarine M3 Enigma machine, which is used during the World War II. 

The Enigma machine has a series of settings that determines how it encrypts each letter. The settings include rotor wheel position, rotor type, and plug-board settings. 

The settings window can be accessed by holding any of the Up, Select or Down buttons.

On the main screen, the input letter can be shifted by pressing the Up or Down button. The button left circle contains the input text and the upper left circle contains the output text. Pressing the Select button adds the input letter to the input message and the corresponding output letter is added to the output message.

data.description:
The ultimate World time watch for Pebble Time and Round. Configurable for 35+ cities/time zones, including half-hour offset zones. 

Supports 3 favorite time zones. Cycle through the 3 favorites with up and down buttons, no need to use the phone to switch between favorite timezones.

Other features:
Completely configurable on your wrist. Also configurable via a configuration page.
Compass function.
Supports 12/24 hour local clock with A/P indicator.
Weather icon with temperature in C or F (local weather).  
Moon phase display. Battery icon.
Local sunrise and sunset time.
Days of week in English, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Spanish and Klingon.
A-Grade energy friendly (extremely low battery usage).
BT disconnect warning (temp goes red with optional vibration). 
Keeps track of DST and timezone date. 
DST on dual time can be set to Automatic (USA based, recommended), On or Off.

This app is also available as watchface, but without the compass. Compass needle is red when not calibrated, orange when almost precise and dark yellow when calibrated. First time calibration is done automatically and can take over a minute!

2 days free trial, price $2.99. This is a bundle offer. If you purchase this app you can download the watchface (same name) for free!

data.description:
Have you ever forgetten someone's name just moments after they shook your hand and told you? Fear no more, the help is here!

Download this watchapp and the companion app "Forget Me Not" from the  Play Store, and use your Pebble Time or Pebble Time Round to remember everyone's name!

With the watchapp open, your Pebble will automatically start listening for names when a handshake is initiated. It will then record the sound, translate it to text, and get the name of the person you just greeted. This will be saved on a list on your phone, together with the time and location of the meeting. After you've met the person, and probably forgotten the name already, you can open the Forget Me Not app on your phone, and see their name once again!

latest_release.release_notes: Functional version of the app, with a cute wallpaper.

Major release with lots of new features:

* Includes a wide range of fully customisable Habit modes. 
* Allows you to track Streak and Count Habits at any frequency, with presets for Hourly, Daily, Weekly, Fortnightly and Monthly. 
* Enables you to choose custom days of the week for your Habits - no more losing the Streak on weekends! (Most requested feature!)

data.description:
Introducing My Habits, the Pebble Timeline app designed to help you start and maintain positive Habits. Available as a one-time paid upgrade to Habits, for $2.99 through KiezelPay.

MY HABITS (paid upgrade)

* Includes a wide range of fully customisable Habit modes. 
* Allows you to track Streak and Count Habits at any frequency, with presets for Hourly, Daily, Weekly, Fortnightly and Monthly. 
* Enables you to choose custom days of the week for your Habits - no more losing the Streak on weekends! (Most requested feature!)
* Special Advanced modes: Hidden pins, Random reminders, and Read-only reminders, and Offline support.
* IFTTT Maker Channel integration.
* Companion Website with statistics and graphs for each Habit, as well as full habit configuration. Manage all of your Habits in one place!
* Third-Party API account access - integrate Habits into your app! (More information: api.my-habits.net)
* Integration with Snowy - the well known personal assistant for Pebble Time.

HABITS (free)

* Track Daily and Weekly Streak Habits, with nudges and custom responses.
* Track Daily Count Habits, with Forceful mode and custom responses.
* All of the existing free Habits features are still free!

For more information about My Habits, please visit my-habits.net. Don't forget, if you like My Habits, please give it a ❤️!
